week0.question: The full form of SDGs is ____
The SDGs have been adopted by ____ member states
SDGs consist of ____ number of goals
SDGs are at the heart of the ____ agenda for sustainable development.
The Agenda ____ was adopted at the Earth Summit
There were ____ number of MDGs given, which were later replaced by the SDGs

week1.question: In June 1992, at the Earth Summit in ____, more than 178 countries adopted Agenda 21
The Brundtland Report published in 1987 is also known as ____
Multidimensional poverty measures reveal the following except
options: range of different disadvantages experienced by the poor
poverty level in different subgroups of people
types of property owned by people in a country
poverty level in different areas of a country
week1.answer: types of property owned by people in a country

week1.question: The Indian government's ____ program prioritizes national wellbeing and is leading change towards SDG 3
Quality education entails issues such as ____
options: Provision of relevant infrastructure for education

week1.question: As per Ministry of Housing and Urban Affairs of India, ____ litre per capita per day (lpcd) has been suggested as the benchmark for urban water supply.
SDG 8 aims to ____
options: Ensure access to affordable, reliable, sustainable and modern energy for all
Ensure availability and sustainable management of water and sanitation for all
Build resilient infrastructure, promote inclusive and sustainable industrialization, and foster innovation
Promote sustained inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all
week1.answer: Promote sustained inclusive and sustainable economic growth, full and productive employment and decent work for all

week1.question: Which of the following is used as a factor or measure of inequality?

____ means that our food practices meet the dietary needs of today in terms of nutrition and satiation, without compromising the needs of future generations (especially regarding ecological concerns).
SDG ____ highlights that we cannot hope for sustainable development without peace, stability, human rights and effective governance

week2.question: An essential characteristic of ESD is that it engages ___ education.
Which of the following is not a characteristic of ESD?
options: It is based on principles and values of sustainable development
It addresses content taking into account the context, global issues and local priorities
It accommodates the stagnant and fixed nature of the concept of sustainability
It uses a variety of pedagogical techniques
week2.answer: It accommodates the stagnant and fixed nature of the concept of sustainability

week2.question: The ___ stated that everyone is entitled to participate in, contribute to, and enjoy economic, social, cultural and political development.
options: Declaration on the Right to Advantage
Declaration on the Right to Enjoyment
Declaration on the Right to Happiness
Declaration on the Right to Development
Declaration on the Right to Prosperity
week2.answer: Declaration on the Right to Development

week2.question: Text-based methods of assessing ESD penetration into programs of study can be improved by using ___.
While MDGs apply to ___ countries, SDGs are applied to ___ countries
The following characteristics apply to the 2030 Agenda except
HRE, a tool for building peaceful and just societies, stands for ___
Creating a world culture of peace requires the involvement of all the following parties except ___
Which international organization has highlighted a policy focusing on education and engagement for indigenous people?

week3.question: The term ‘global citizenship’ refers to the belief that individuals are members of ___ networks. Which of the following options is not an appropriate option to complete the sentence?
Which of the following is false about global citizenship?
options: It is about the belief that we can all make a difference
A global citizen is someone is aware of and understands the wider role
Global citizens take a passive role in their community to make our planet more sustainable.
Global citizenship is all about encouraging young people to develop characteristics they need to engage with the world.
week3.answer: Global citizens take a passive role in their community to make our planet more sustainable.

week3.question: UNESCO’s work in the field of global citizenship is guided primarily by ___
Global citizenship ___
options: instills the confidence that people cannot do much to change the world
teaches learners to have their voices heard
week3.answer: teaches learners to have their voices heard

week3.question: Which of the following is untrue about global citizens?
options: they apply knowledge and empathy to real-life problems
they actively collaborate with diverse people
they see the interdependence of globalization
they generally know how the world works

week3.question: GCED is based on three domains of learning. Which of the following is not one of them?
UNESCO-MGIEP has called for integrating ___ in education systems.
___ is an under-recognized resource for sustainable development that defines citizens’ shared identity.
TVET stands for ____
options: Teaching and Vocational Education and Training
Teaching for Vulnerability Education and Training
Technical Variety of Education and Training
Technical and Vocational Education and Training
week3.answer: Technical and Vocational Education and Training

week3.question: A green economy has four interconnected and mutually dependent goals. Which of the following is not one of them?

week4.question: The classification of ___ refers to the creation of new work or occupation and work requirements that may be born out of occupations that already exist.
The International Framework for greening TVET for green society gives a ___-tier approach.
The five dimensions or criteria of greening TVET include the following except ___
Which of the following is not an indicator of green culture?
___ as an umbrella term often includes social entrepreneurship, eco-preneurship and intra-preneurship
The definition most commonly used to understand a sustainable healthcare system is given by ___.
A genuinely sustainable healthcare system has the following characteristics except ___
options: promotes population health with minimal financial costs
focuses only on meeting healthcare needs
week4.answer: focuses only on meeting healthcare needs

week4.question: There are ___ number of accelerator themes under the Global Action Plan for Healthy Lives and Wellbeing
Which of the following is not one of the accelerator themes under the Global Action Plan for Healthy Lives and Wellbeing?
Which of the following is not a dimension of health?

week5.question: Which of the following is an existing problem of healthcare infrastructure in India?
options: Healthcare infrastructure heavily skewed in favor of women

week5.question: WHO’s framework of health system building blocks include the following except ___
Sustainability of a healthcare system depends on ___ number of major factors which include internal and external factors
Costs related to value in healthcare include ___
The ___ is India’s flagship programme to improve nutritional outcomes for children, pregnant women and lactating mothers
Which of the following is not one of the four stages for Sustainable Quality Improvement (Sus-QI)
Sus-QI extends the scope of QI by including the following except ___
Ideally, when considering the environmental impacts of a system, one would calculate total ___ instead of just estimating greenhouse gas emissions
A ___ has been defined as an environment in which data of medical interest can be stired and made easily available to different actors in the healthcare system.
With respect to value in healthcare, outcomes refer to ___

week6.question: Which of the following is a cause of hunger?
Hidden hunger as a form of malnutrition has to do with ___ of food more than the ___
Desertification typically is a result of the following except ___
Which of the following is a sustainable agriculture practice?
Which of the following policy changes are essential to improve India’s hunger situation?
options: Decrease the earned income tax credit for childless workers

week6.question: ___ crops can handle temperature and precipitation variation and precipitation fluctuations.
India will probably suffer with wheat production due to global warming. Wheat productivity is dependent on ___
Bringing forgotten and neglected foods like millets and yam into cultivation and onto the market is known as ___
Which of the following is a type of electric vehicle?
___ won the Peace Nobel in 2007, an acknowledgment of its efforts in creating awareness for the fight against climate change

week7.question: IPCC by the United Nations categorised key drivers, opportunities and benefits of renewable energy into some categories. IPCC stands for ___.
options: Intergovernmental Practical for Climate and Culture

week7.question: The greatest contributor to outdoor air pollution in India is ___.
options: Burning of solid biomass for cooking and heating
week7.answer: Burning of solid biomass for cooking and heating

week7.question: The term ___ grew out of the climate justice movement, and is grounded on the basic understanding that “the decisions that shape our lives should be established jointly and without regard to the principle of profit.

Increased deployment of renewable energy has been shown to improve energy security in the EU, where renewable’s substitution for natural gas accounted for 30% of the estimated reduction in fossil fuel demand during 2013. This is an example of ___ impact of renewable energy.
___ is now recognized as a promising and attractive energy carrier to decarbonize the sectors responsible for global warming, such as electricity production, industry, and transportation
___ was the first state in India to introduce a comprehensive EV policy and has emerged as an integral hotspot for EV businesses in the country.

With the Paris Agreement, countries established ___, under which, starting in 2024, countries will report transparently on actions taken and progress in climate change mitigation, adaptation measures and support provided or received
The Government of India launched the National Action Plan on Climate Change in 2008 outlining ___ number of National Missions.
Which of the following is not one of the missions given by National Action Plan on Climate Change in 2008?
options: National Mission for a Green India

week7.question: There are three major means of implementation of SDG 4. Which of the following is not one of them?

week8.question: Which of the following is not one of the four policy support mechanisms for the Okayama Commitment by Japan (2014)?
The Frame model gives three goal dimensions (GD). Which of the following is not one of them?
Value and attitudes come under the ___ facets of sustainable competencies.
Which of the following statements is false regarding perspectives of sustainable development?
options: Women play a vital role in environmental management and development
Countries should promote appropriate demographic policies
Peace, development and environmental protection are independent of each other
A systems thinking approach is important
week8.answer: Peace, development and environmental protection are independent of each other

week8.question: ___ competency is the ability to collectively develop and implement innovative actions that further sustainability at the local level and further a field.
___ competency refers to the ability to understand and evaluate multiple futures – possible, probable and desirable – and to create one’s own visions for the future
In the ___ approaches, the process is organized in a manner that enable all stakeholders to jointly develop a vision and plan to implement ESD.
Which of the following is not true regarding the learner centered approach to ESD?
options: emphasizes the active development of knowledge
requires learners to reflect on their own knowledge and learning process
change the role of an educator from that of a facilitator to an expert who transfers structured knowledge
week8.answer: change the role of an educator from that of a facilitator to an expert who transfers structured knowledge

week8.question: Action-learning draws on Kolb’s learning cycle of ___ learning.

week9.question: Which of the following is not an example of vision building exercises that are used as a key method in ESD?
Communication skills, empathy, compassion and leadership are examples of which of the key competency area proposed for the assessment of ESD?
___ is the ability to stay present to your internal environment at the same time as engaging with your external environment
Which of the following is not one of the intelligences proposed by Gardner in the model of multiple intelligences?
The idea of ___ implies changes in individual action intertwined with reorganization of societal structures.
Which of the following is false about transformative learning?
options: involves a fundamental change in our perspectives
learners started to question all the things they knew to make room for new insights and information
has two major focuses: Instrumental learning and Communicative learning

week9.question: Which of the following is not one of the phases given in Mezirow’s 10 phases of transformative learning?
Need to know why, Self-Concept, Role of experience, Readiness to learn, Orientation to learning and Motivation are six assumptions often stated as principles of ___
In the sustainable education model in the Indian context by Mohanty(2019), the role of driver 1 of profit is played by ___
TPACK in the context of ESD and transformative learning stands for ___

week10.question: Which of the following is false about sustainable leaders?
options: See the role their organization plays in a larger context
Aim to work to meet the triple bottom line
Focus only on the environment while ignoring the financial performance
week10.answer: Focus only on the environment while ignoring the financial performance

week10.question: The triple bottom line approach focuses on the three ___
Which of the following is a behavior of sustainable leaders?
A ___ is a strong interior sense of purpose combined with a long term orientation and an inherent motivation to meet the triple bottom line
Which of the following is not a sustainable leadership practice?
Which of the following is not a component of the 360 degree sustainable leadership?
Which of the following statements is false?
options: Sustainable leadership sustains the leadership of others
Sustainable leadership ignores issues of social justice and only focuses on climate issues
Sustainable leadership develops human and material resources
week10.answer: Sustainable leadership ignores issues of social justice and only focuses on climate issues

week10.question: Working style of sustainable leaders is ___
Which of the following is not one of the basic principles of lean leadership?
options: Ignore the innovations and punish lack of it
week10.answer: Ignore the innovations and punish lack of it

week10.question: Which of the following is not one of the higher level practices in the sustainable leadership pyramid?

What is a major challenge for creating sustainable cities?
Which initiative promotes sustainable urban development globally?
Community engagement in sustainable cities involves:
Green spaces in cities contribute to:
Which technology supports sustainable city management?

week12.question: Sustainable consumption and production (SCP) aims to:
options: Do more and better with less
week12.answer: Do more and better with less

week12.question: Which SDG specifically targets Responsible Consumption and Production?
The concept of a 'circular economy' is closely related to:
Life Cycle Assessment (LCA) is a tool used to:
options: Evaluate the environmental impacts of a product throughout its life
week12.answer: Evaluate the environmental impacts of a product throughout its life

week12.question: Which of the following is NOT a principle of sustainable consumption?
Global partnerships for sustainable development (SDG 17) emphasize:
Key areas for global partnerships include:

options: The well-being of others and the planet
week12.answer: The well-being of others and the planet

week12.question: Factors contributing to sustainable happiness include all except:
Education for Sustainable Development (ESD) plays a role in fostering:
